020import static java.lang.ClassLoader.getPlatformClassLoader;
021import static java.lang.Thread.currentThread;
022import static java.lang.Thread.getAllStackTraces;
023import static java.lang.reflect.Modifier.isAbstract;
024import static java.lang.reflect.Modifier.isFinal;
025import static java.lang.reflect.Modifier.isNative;
026import static java.lang.reflect.Modifier.isPrivate;
027import static java.lang.reflect.Modifier.isProtected;
028import static java.lang.reflect.Modifier.isPublic;
029import static java.lang.reflect.Modifier.isStatic;
030import static java.lang.reflect.Modifier.isStrict;
031import static java.lang.reflect.Modifier.isSynchronized;
032import static java.lang.reflect.Modifier.isTransient;
033import static java.lang.reflect.Modifier.isVolatile;
034import static java.util.Arrays.stream;

037import static javax.lang.model.element.Modifier.FINAL;

056import static org.tquadrat.foundation.util.StringUtils.isNotEmpty;

081/**
082 *  <p>{@summary This class provides a bunch of helper methods that deal with the Java
083 *  language itself and some related areas.} In general, they are wrapping
084 *  somehow the introspection and the reflection frameworks.</p>
085 *  <p>All methods of this class are static, so no instance of this class is
086 *  allowed.</p>
087 *
088 *  @extauthor Thomas Thrien - thomas.thrien@tquadrat.org
089 *  @version $Id: JavaUtils.java 966 2022-01-04 22:28:49Z tquadrat $
090 *  @since 0.0.5
091 *
092 *  @UMLGraph.link
093 */
094@SuppressWarnings( {"ClassWithTooManyMethods", "OverlyComplexClass"} )
095@ClassVersion( sourceVersion = "$Id: JavaUtils.java 966 2022-01-04 22:28:49Z tquadrat $" )
096@UtilityClass
097public final class JavaUtils
098{
099        /*-----------*\
100    ====** Constants **========================================================
101        \*-----------*/
102    /**
103     *  The prefix for the name of an 'add' method: {@value}
104     */
105    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.1.0" )
106    public static final String PREFIX_ADD = "add";
107
108    /**
109     *  The prefix for the name of a getter method: {@value}.
110     */
111    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
112    public static final String PREFIX_GET = "get";
113
114    /**
115     *  The prefix for the name of a getter method that returns a
116     *  {@code boolean} value: {@value}.
117     */
118    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
119    public static final String PREFIX_IS = "is";
120
121    /**
122     *  The prefix for the name of a setter method: {@value}
123     */
124    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
125    public static final String PREFIX_SET = "set";
126
127        /*------------------------*\
128    ====** Static Initialisations **===========================================
129        \*------------------------*/
130    /**
131     *  The flag that tracks the assertion on/off status for this package.
132     */
133    private static boolean m_AssertionOn;
134
135    /**
136     *  Unfortunately,
137     *  {@link Class#forName(String, boolean, ClassLoader)}
138     *  will not work for the classes of the primitive types. To enable
139     *  {@link #loadClass(ClassLoader, String)}
140     *  to return those classes, we use this table.
141     */
142    private static final Map<String,Class<?>> m_PrimitiveClasses;
143
144    static
145    {
146        //---* Determine the assertion status *--------------------------------
147        m_AssertionOn = false;
148        /*
149         * As the JUnit tests will always be executed with the flag
150         * "-ea" (assertions enabled), this code sequence is not tested in all
151         * branches.
152         */
153        //noinspection AssertWithSideEffects,PointlessBooleanExpression
154        assert (m_AssertionOn = true) == true : "Assertion is switched off";
155
156        //---* Create the table with the primitive type class objects *--------
157        m_PrimitiveClasses = Map.of(
158            "boolean", boolean.class,
159            "byte", byte.class,
160            "char", char.class,
161            "double", double.class,
162            "float", float.class,
163            "int", int.class,
164            "long", long.class,
165            "short", short.class,
166            "void", Void.class );
167    }
168

171        \*--------------*/
172    /**
173     *  No instance allowed for this class.
174     */
175    private JavaUtils() { throw new PrivateConstructorForStaticClassCalledError( JavaUtils.class ); }
176
177        /*---------*\
178    ====** Methods **==========================================================
179        \*---------*/
180    /**
181     *  Creates the name for the getter method for the property with the given
182     *  name. It will always be generated with '{@code get}', names for
183     *  {@code boolean} properties (that usually do start with '{@code is}')
184     *  are not generated.
185     *
186     *  @param  propertyName    The name of the property.
187     *  @return The name for the getter of the respective property.
188     */
189    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
190    public static final String composeGetterName( final String propertyName )
191    {
192        final var retValue = PREFIX_GET + capitalize( requireNotEmptyArgument( propertyName, "propertyName" ) );
193
194        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
195        return retValue;
196    }   //  composeGetterName()
197
198    /**
199     *  Creates the name for the setter method for the property with the given
200     *  name.
201     *
202     *  @param  propertyName    The name of the property.
203     *  @return The name for the setter of the respective property.
204     */
205    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
206    public static final String composeSetterName( final String propertyName )
207    {
208        final var retValue = PREFIX_SET + capitalize( requireNotEmptyArgument( propertyName, "propertyName" ) );
209
210        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
211        return retValue;
212    }   //  composeSetterName()
213
214    /**
215     *  <p>{@summary This method will find the caller for the method that calls
216     *  this one and returns the appropriate stack trace element.}</p>
217     *  <p>The {@code offset} determines which caller's stack trace element
218     *  will be returned:</p>
219     *  <ol start="0">
220     *      <li>this method</li>
221     *      <li>the caller of this method</li>
222     *      <li>the caller's caller</li>
223     *      <li>… and so on</li>
224     *  </ol>
225     *
226     *  @param  offset  The offset on the stack for the correct entry.
227     *  @return An instance of
228     *      {@link Optional}
229     *      that holds the stack trace element for the caller; will be empty if
230     *      the offset is too high (higher than the number of call levels).
231     */
232    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
233    public static final Optional<StackTraceElement> findCaller( final int offset )
234    {
235        if( offset < 0 ) throw new ValidationException( "offset is negative" );
236
237        //---* Retrieve the stack *--------------------------------------------
238        final var stackTraceElements = currentThread().getStackTrace();
239        final var len = stackTraceElements.length;
240
241        //---* Search the stack *----------------------------------------------
242        Optional<StackTraceElement> retValue = Optional.empty();
243        if( offset <= len )
244        {
245            String className;
246            String methodName;
247            FindLoop: for( var i = 0; i < len; ++i )
248            {
249                /*
250                 * This loop searches the stack until it will find the entry
251                 * for this method on it. It assumes then that the next entry
252                 * on the stack will belong to the caller for this method, and
253                 * that one after it will be the caller's caller - and so on.
254                 * The stack trace element for this method is not necessarily
255                 * the first on the stack, as getStackTrace() is on it as well,
256                 * and the exact index for this method depends on the
257                 * implementation of the VM and/or the Java Runtime Library.
258                 */
259                className = stackTraceElements [i].getClassName();
260                methodName = stackTraceElements [i].getMethodName();
261                if( className.equals( JavaUtils.class.getName() ) && "findCaller".equals( methodName ) )
262                {
263                    if( (i + offset) < len )
264                    {
265                        retValue = Optional.of( stackTraceElements [i + offset] );
266                    }
267                    break FindLoop;
268                }
269            }   //  FindLoop:
270        }
271
272        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
273        return retValue;
274    }   //  findCaller()
275
276    /**
277     *  <p>{@summary Tries to identify the class with the {@code main()} method
278     *  that started the application.}</p>
279     *  <p>There are several reasons why this could fail:</p>
280     *  <ul>
281     *      <li>There is a
282     *      {@link java.lang.SecurityManager}
283     *      in place that forbids to access the necessary information.</li>
284     *      <li>The {@code main} thread is already dead. This could happen
285     *      with applications having a graphical user interface, or where the
286     *      main class is mere starter for the real application threads.</li>
287     *      <li>The code was not started as a program at all; this could be the
288     *      fact for applets, or when it is started as a script.</li>
289     *  </ul>
290     *
291     *  @return An instance of
292     *      {@link Optional}
293     *      that holds the name of the main class.
294     */
295    @SuppressWarnings( "removal" )
296    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
297    public static final Optional<String> findMainClass()
298    {
299        String mainClassName = null;
300        try
301        {
302            //---* First, we will see if we are the main thread *--------------
303            final var t = currentThread();
304            StackTraceElement [] stackTrace;
305            if( "main".equals( t.getName() ) )
306            {
307                //---* Search for the method main() *--------------------------
308                stackTrace = t.getStackTrace();
309                mainClassName = searchStackTrace( stackTrace, "main" );
310
311                if( isNull( mainClassName ) )
312                {
313                    /*
314                     * There is no main() method in the main thread; this can
315                     * happen if we were triggered from a static block. So
316                     * let's search for <clinit>.
317                     */
318                    mainClassName = searchStackTrace( stackTrace, "<clinit>" );
319                }
320            }
321
322            //---* Not found yet, so we will search for the main thread *------
323            if( isNull( mainClassName ) )
324            {
325                final var stackTraces = getAllStackTraces();
326                ThreadSearchLoop: for( final var thread : stackTraces.keySet() )
327                {
328                    if( "main".equals( thread.getName() ) )
329                    {
330                        //---* Search for the method main() *------------------
331                        stackTrace = stackTraces.get( thread );
332                        mainClassName = searchStackTrace( stackTrace, "main" );
333                        if( isNull( mainClassName ) )
334                        {
335                            /*
336                             * There is no main() method in the main thread;
337                             * this can happen if we were triggered from a
338                             * static block. So let's search for <clinit>.
339                             */
340                            mainClassName = searchStackTrace( stackTrace, "<clinit>" );
341                        }
342                        if( nonNull( mainClassName ) ) break ThreadSearchLoop;
343                    }
344                }   //  ThreadSearchLoop:
345            }
346        }
347        catch( @SuppressWarnings( "unused" ) final SecurityException e ) { /* Deliberately ignored */ }
348
349        //---* Compose the return value *--------------------------------------
350        final var retValue = Optional.ofNullable( mainClassName );
351
352        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
353        return retValue;
354    }   //  findMainClass()
355
356    /**
357     *  <p>{@summary Retrieves the
358     *  {@link ClassLoader}
359     *  that loaded the class of the method that called the method that called
360     *  this method.}</p>
361     *  <p>If the class of the caller's caller was loaded by the Bootstrap
362     *  classloader, the return value would be {@code null}, but this method
363     *  will return the
364     *  {@linkplain ClassLoader#getPlatformClassLoader() Platform classloader}
365     *  instead.</p>
366     *
367     *  @return The caller's {@code ClassLoader}.
368     *
369     *  @see #findCaller(int)
370     *
371     *  @since 0.0.6
372     */
373    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.6" )
374    public static final ClassLoader getCallersClassLoader()
375    {
376        ClassLoader retValue = null;
377        try
378        {
379            final var callersCaller = findCaller( 3 );
380            @SuppressWarnings( "OptionalGetWithoutIsPresent" )
381            final var callersClass = Class.forName( callersCaller.get().getClassName() );
382            retValue = callersClass.getClassLoader();
383            if( isNull( retValue ) ) retValue = getPlatformClassLoader();
384        }
385        catch( final NoSuchElementException e )
386        {
387            throw new UnexpectedExceptionError( "Caller's caller must be on the stack", e );
388        }
389        catch( final ClassNotFoundException e )
390        {
391            throw new UnexpectedExceptionError( "Caller's class must exist", e );
392        }
393
394        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
395        return retValue;
396    }   //  getCallersClassLoader()
397
398    /**
399     *  <p>{@summary Retrieves the location from where the code for the given
400     *  class was loaded.}</p>
401     *  <p>No location will be provided for classes from the Java run-time
402     *  library (like
403     *  {@link java.lang.String})
404     *  or if there is a
405     *  {@link java.lang.SecurityManager}
406     *  in place that forbids this operation.</p>
407     *  <p>Additionally, there are implementations of
408     *  {@link java.lang.ClassLoader}
409     *  that do not initialise the respective data structures
410     *  appropriately.</p>
411     *
412     *  @param  c   The class to inspect.
413     *  @return An instance of
414     *      {@link Optional}
415     *      that holds the URL for the code source.
416     */
417    @SuppressWarnings( "removal" )
418    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
419    public static final Optional<URL> getCodeSource( final Class<?> c )
420    {
421        Optional<URL> retValue = Optional.empty();
422        try
423        {
424            final var protectionDomain = requireNonNullArgument( c, "c" ).getProtectionDomain();
425            if( nonNull( protectionDomain ) )
426            {
427                final var codeSource = protectionDomain.getCodeSource();
428                if( nonNull( codeSource ) )
429                {
430                    retValue = Optional.ofNullable( codeSource.getLocation() );
431                }
432            }
433        }
434        catch( @SuppressWarnings( "unused" ) final SecurityException e ) { /* Deliberately ignored */ }
435
436        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
437        return retValue;
438    }   //  getCodeSource()
439
440    /**
441     *  <p>{@summary Checks if the given element is an '<i>add</i>' method or
442     *  not.} Such a method is a bit like a
443     *  {@linkplain #isSetter(Element) setter method},
444     *  but for
445     *  {@link java.util.Collection Collection}
446     *  instances or alike.</p>
447     *  <p>Such an 'add' method is characterised by being public, not being
448     *  default and not being static; it has a name starting with '{@code add}',
449     *  it takes exactly one parameter, and it does not return any value.</p>
450     *  <p>The remaining part of the name after '{@code add}' is taken as the
451     *  name of the property.</p>
452     *
453     *  @param  element The element to check.
454     *  @return {@code true} if the method is an 'add' method, {@code false}
455     *      otherwise.
456     *
457     *  @see #isGetter(Element)
458     *  @see #isSetter(Element)
459     *
460     *  @since 0.1.0
461     */
462    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.1.0" )
463    public static final boolean isAddMethod( final Element element )
464    {
465        //---* Check whether the element is a method at all *------------------
466        var retValue = requireNonNullArgument( element, "element" ).getKind() == ElementKind.METHOD;
467        if( retValue )
468        {
469            final var methodElement = (ExecutableElement) element;
470
471            //---* Check if the method is public and not static *--------------
472            final var modifiers = methodElement.getModifiers();
473            if( (retValue = modifiers.contains( PUBLIC ) && !modifiers.contains( STATIC ) && !modifiers.contains( DEFAULT )) == true )
474            {
475                //---* Check the name *----------------------------------------
476                final var name = methodElement.getSimpleName().toString();
477                if( (retValue = name.startsWith( PREFIX_ADD )) == true )
478                {
479                    //---* Check if there is a property name *-----------------
480                    final var pos = PREFIX_ADD.length();
481                    retValue = (name.length() > pos) && Character.isUpperCase( name.charAt( pos ) );
482
483                    //---* Check the number of parameters *--------------------
484                    retValue &= (methodElement.getParameters().size() == 1);
485
486                    //---* Check the return value *----------------------------
487                    retValue &= methodElement.getReturnType() instanceof NoType;
488                }
489            }
490        }
491
492        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
493        return retValue;
494    }   //  isAddMethod()
495
496    /**
497     *  Checks whether JDK assertion is currently activated, meaning that the
498     *  program was started with the command line flags {@code -ea} or
499     *  {@code -enableassertions}. If assertions are activated for some
500     *  selected packages only and {@code org.tquadrat.foundation.util} is not
501     *  amongst these, or {@code org.tquadrat.foundation.util} is explicitly
502     *  disabled with {@code -da} or {@code -disableassertions}, this method
503     *  will return {@code false}. But even when it returns {@code true}, it is
504     *  possible that assertions are still not activated for some packages.
505     *
506     *  @return {@code true} if assertions are activated for the
507     *      package {@code org.tquadrat.util} and hopefully also for any other
508     *      package, {@code false} otherwise.
509     */
510    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
511    public static final boolean isAssertionOn() { return m_AssertionOn; }
512
513    /**
514     *  Checks if the given method is the method
515     *  {@link Object#equals(Object) equals()}
516     *  as defined by the class {@code Object}. To be this method, it has to be
517     *  public, it has to have the name 'equals', it has to take one argument
518     *  of type {@code Object} and it will return a result of type
519     *  {@code boolean}.
520     *
521     *  @param  method  The method to check.
522     *  @return {@code true} if the method is the {@code equals()} method,
523     *      {@code false} otherwise.
524     */
525    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
526    public static final boolean isEquals( final Method method )
527    {
528        //---* Check if the method is public and not static *------------------
529        final var modifier = requireNonNullArgument( method, "method" ).getModifiers();
530        var retValue = isPublic( modifier ) && !isStatic( modifier );
531
532        //---* Check the name *------------------------------------------------
533        retValue &= "equals".equals( method.getName() );
534
535        //---* Check the return value *----------------------------------------
536        retValue &= method.getReturnType().equals( boolean.class );
537
538        //---* Check the parameters *------------------------------------------
539        if( retValue )
540        {
541            final var parameterTypes = method.getParameterTypes();
542            retValue = (parameterTypes.length == 1) && Object.class.equals( parameterTypes [0] );
543        }
544
545        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
546        return retValue;
547    }   //  isEquals()
548
549    /**
550     *  <p>{@summary Checks whether the given element is a <i>getter</i> method
551     *  or not.}</p>
552     *  <p>A getter method is public and not static, it has a name starting
553     *  with &quot;{@code get}&quot;, it does not take any arguments, and it
554     *  will return a value. In case the return value is of type
555     *  {@code boolean}, the name may start with &quot;{@code is}&quot; instead
556     *  of &quot;{@code get}&quot;.</p>
557     *  <p>The remaining part of the name after &quot;{@code get}&quot; or
558     *  &quot;{@code is}&quot; has to start with an uppercase letter; this is
559     *  usually taken as the attribute's or property's name.</p>
560     *  <p>For the method
561     *  {@link Object#getClass()}
562     *  (inherited by all classes from
563     *  {@link Object}),
564     *  this method will return {@code false}, as this is not a getter in the
565     *  sense of the definition.</p>
566     *
567     *  @param  element  The element to check.
568     *  @return {@code true} if the element is a getter method, {@code false}
569     *      otherwise.
570     */
571    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
572    public static final boolean isGetter( final Element element )
573    {
574        //---* Check whether the element is a method at all *------------------
575        var retValue = requireNonNullArgument( element, "element" ).getKind() == ElementKind.METHOD;
576        if( retValue )
577        {
578            final var methodElement = (ExecutableElement) element;
579
580            //---* Check if the method is public and not static *--------------
581            final var modifiers = methodElement.getModifiers();
582            if( (retValue = modifiers.contains( PUBLIC ) && !modifiers.contains( STATIC )) == true )
583            {
584                //---* Check the name *----------------------------------------
585                final var name = methodElement.getSimpleName().toString();
586                if( (retValue = !"getClass".equals( name )) == true )
587                {
588                    var pos = 0;
589                    if( name.startsWith( PREFIX_IS ) )
590                    {
591                        //---* Check the return value *------------------------
592                        final var returnMirror = methodElement.getReturnType();
593                        retValue = !(returnMirror instanceof NoType) && (returnMirror.getKind() == TypeKind.BOOLEAN);
594                        pos = PREFIX_IS.length();
595                    }
596                    else if( name.startsWith( PREFIX_GET ) )
597                    {
598                        //---* Check the return value *------------------------
599                        retValue = !(methodElement.getReturnType() instanceof NoType);
600                        pos = PREFIX_GET.length();
601                    }
602                    else
603                    {
604                        retValue = false;
605                    }
606
607                    if( retValue )
608                    {
609                        //---* Check if there is a property name *-------------
610                        retValue = (name.length() > pos) && Character.isUpperCase( name.charAt( pos ) );
611
612                        //---* Check the number of parameters *----------------
613                        retValue = retValue && methodElement.getParameters().isEmpty();
614                    }
615                }
616            }
617        }
618
619        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
620        return retValue;
621    }   //  isGetter()
622
623    /**
624     *  <p>{@summary Checks whether the given method is a <i>getter</i> method
625     *  or not.}</p>
626     *  <p>A getter method is public and not static, it has a name starting
627     *  with &quot;{@code get}&quot;, it does not take any arguments, and it
628     *  will return a value. In case the return value is of type
629     *  {@code boolean}, the name may start with &quot;{@code is}&quot; instead
630     *  of &quot;{@code get}&quot;.</p>
631     *  <p>The remaining part of the name after &quot;{@code get}&quot; or
632     *  &quot;{@code is}&quot; has to start with an uppercase letter; this is
633     *  usually taken as the attribute's or property's name.</p>
634     *  <p>For the method
635     *  {@link Object#getClass()}
636     *  (inherited by all classes from
637     *  {@link Object}),
638     *  this method will return {@code false}, as this is not a getter in the
639     *  sense of the definition.</p>
640     *
641     *  @param  method  The method to check.
642     *  @return {@code true} if the method is a getter, {@code false}
643     *      otherwise.
644     */
645    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
646    public static final boolean isGetter( final Method method )
647    {
648        //---* Check if the method is public and not static *------------------
649        final var modifier = requireNonNullArgument( method, "method" ).getModifiers();
650        var retValue = isPublic( modifier ) && !isStatic( modifier );
651
652        //---* Check the number of parameters *--------------------------------
653        retValue = retValue && (method.getParameterTypes().length == 0);
654
655        //---* Check the name *------------------------------------------------
656        if( retValue )
657        {
658            final var name = method.getName();
659            retValue = !"getClass".equals( name );
660
661            if( retValue )
662            {
663                var pos = Integer.MAX_VALUE;
664                if( name.startsWith( PREFIX_IS ) )
665                {
666                    retValue = method.getReturnType().equals( boolean.class );
667                    pos = PREFIX_IS.length();
668                }
669                else if( name.startsWith( PREFIX_GET ) )
670                {
671                    //---* Check the return value *----------------------------
672                    retValue = !method.getReturnType().equals( void.class );
673                    pos = PREFIX_GET.length();
674                }
675                else
676                {
677                    retValue = false;
678                }
679
680                //---* Check if there is a property name *---------------------
681                retValue = retValue && (name.length() > pos) && Character.isUpperCase( name.charAt( pos ) );
682            }
683        }
684
685        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
686        return retValue;
687    }   //  isGetter()
688
689    /**
690     *  Checks if the given method is the method
691     *  {@link Object#hashCode() hashCode()}
692     *  as defined by the class {@code Object}. To be this method, it has to be
693     *  public, it has to have the name 'hashCode', it does not take any
694     *  argument, and it will return a result of type {@code integer}.
695     *
696     *  @param  method  The method to check.
697     *  @return {@code true} if the method is the {@code hashCode()}
698     *      method, {@code false} otherwise.
699     */
700    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
701    public static final boolean isHashCode( final Method method )
702    {
703        //---* Check if the method is public and not static *------------------
704        final var modifier = requireNonNullArgument( method, "method" ).getModifiers();
705        var retValue = isPublic( modifier ) && !isStatic( modifier );
706
707        //---* Check the name *------------------------------------------------
708        retValue &= "hashCode".equals( method.getName() );
709
710        //---* Check the return value *----------------------------------------
711        retValue &= method.getReturnType().equals( int.class );
712
713        //---* Check the number of parameters *--------------------------------
714        retValue &= (method.getParameterTypes().length == 0);
715
716        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
717        return retValue;
718    }   //  isHashCode()
719
720    /**
721     *  Checks if the given method is a {@code main()} method or not. A
722     *  {@code main()} method is public and static, it has the name
723     *  &quot;main&quot;, it takes exactly one parameter of type
724     *  {@code String []}, and it does not return any value.
725     *
726     *  @param  method  The method to check.
727     *  @return {@code true} if the method is a {@code main()} method,
728     *      {@code false} otherwise.
729     */
730    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
731    public static final boolean isMain( final Method method )
732    {
733        //---* Check if the method is public and static *----------------------
734        final var modifier = requireNonNullArgument( method, "method" ).getModifiers();
735        var retValue = isPublic( modifier ) && isStatic( modifier );
736
737        //---* Check the name *------------------------------------------------
738        retValue &= "main".equals( method.getName() );
739
740        //---* Check the return value *----------------------------------------
741        retValue &= method.getReturnType().equals( void.class );
742
743        //---* Check the number of parameters *--------------------------------
744        if( retValue )
745        {
746            final var parameterTypes = method.getParameterTypes();
747            retValue = (parameterTypes.length == 1) && String [].class.equals( parameterTypes [0] );
748        }
749
750        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
751        return retValue;
752    }   //  isMain()
753
754    /**
755     *  <p>{@summary Checks if the given element is a setter method or not.} A
756     *  setter method is public, it has a name starting with 'set', it takes
757     *  exactly one parameter, and it does not return any value.</p>
758     *  <p>The remaining part of the name after 'set' is taken as the
759     *  attribute's name.</p>
760     *
761     *  @param  element The element to check.
762     *  @return {@code true} if the method is a setter, {@code false}
763     *      otherwise.
764     */
765    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
766    public static final boolean isSetter( final Element element )
767    {
768        //---* Check whether the element is a method at all *------------------
769        var retValue = requireNonNullArgument( element, "element" ).getKind() == ElementKind.METHOD;
770        if( retValue )
771        {
772            final var methodElement = (ExecutableElement) element;
773
774            //---* Check if the method is public and not static *--------------
775            final var modifiers = methodElement.getModifiers();
776            if( (retValue = modifiers.contains( PUBLIC ) && !modifiers.contains( STATIC )) == true )
777            {
778                //---* Check the name *----------------------------------------
779                final var name = methodElement.getSimpleName().toString();
780                if( (retValue = name.startsWith( PREFIX_SET )) == true )
781                {
782                    //---* Check if there is a property name *-----------------
783                    final var pos = PREFIX_SET.length();
784                    retValue = (name.length() > pos) && Character.isUpperCase( name.charAt( pos ) );
785
786                    //---* Check the number of parameters *--------------------
787                    retValue &= (methodElement.getParameters().size() == 1);
788
789                    //---* Check the return value *----------------------------
790                    retValue &= methodElement.getReturnType() instanceof NoType;
791                }
792            }
793        }
794
795        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
796        return retValue;
797    }   //  isSetter()
798
799    /**
800     *  Checks if the given method is a setter method or not. A setter method
801     *  is public, it has a name starting with 'set', it takes exactly one
802     *  parameter, and it does not return any value.<br>
803     *  <br>The remaining part of the name after 'set' is taken as the
804     *  attribute's name.
805     *
806     *  @param  method  The method to check.
807     *  @return {@code true} if the method is a setter, {@code false}
808     *      otherwise.
809     */
810    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
811    public static final boolean isSetter( final Method method )
812    {
813        //---* Check if the method is public and not static *------------------
814        final var modifier = requireNonNullArgument( method, "method" ).getModifiers();
815        var retValue = isPublic( modifier ) && !isStatic( modifier );
816
817        //---* Check the name *------------------------------------------------
818        if( retValue )
819        {
820            final var name = method.getName();
821            retValue = name.startsWith( PREFIX_SET );
822
823            //---* Check if there is a property name *-------------------------
824            final var pos = PREFIX_SET.length();
825            retValue &= (name.length() > pos) && Character.isUpperCase( name.charAt( pos ) );
826        }
827
828        //---* Check the number of parameters *--------------------------------
829        retValue &= (method.getParameterTypes().length == 1);
830
831        //---* Check the return value *----------------------------------------
832        retValue &= method.getReturnType().equals( void.class );
833
834        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
835        return retValue;
836    }   //  isSetter()
837
838    /**
839     *  Checks if the given method is the method
840     *  {@link Object#toString() toString()}
841     *  as defined by the class {@code Object}. To be this method, it has to be
842     *  public, it has to have the name 'toString', it does not take any
843     *  argument, and it returns a result of type
844     *  {@link String}.
845     *
846     *  @param  method  The method to check.
847     *  @return {@code true} if the method is the {@code toString()}
848     *      method, {@code false} otherwise.
849     */
850    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
851    public static final boolean isToString( final Method method )
852    {
853        //---* Check if the method is public and not static *------------------
854        final var modifier = requireNonNullArgument( method, "method" ).getModifiers();
855        var retValue = isPublic( modifier ) && !isStatic( modifier );
856
857        //---* Check the name *------------------------------------------------
858        retValue &= "toString".equals( method.getName() );
859
860        //---* Check the return value *----------------------------------------
861        retValue &= method.getReturnType().equals( String.class );
862
863        //---* Check the number of parameters *--------------------------------
864        retValue &= (method.getParameterTypes().length == 0);
865
866        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
867        return retValue;
868    }   //  isToString()
869
870    /**
871     *  Checks whether the given String is a valid Java name.<br>
872     *  <br>This method will return {@code true} for <i>restricted
873     *  keywords</i>, but not for {@code var}. For a single underscore
874     *  (&quot;{@code _}&quot;), it will return {@code false}.<br>
875     *  <br>The restricted keywords are
876     *  <ul>
877     *  <li>{@code exports}</li>
878     *  <li>{@code module}</li>
879     *  <li>{@code open}</li>
880     *  <li>{@code opens}</li>
881     *  <li>{@code provides}</li>
882     *  <li>{@code requires}</li>
883     *  <li>{@code to}</li>
884     *  <li>{@code transitive}</li>
885     *  <li>{@code uses}</li>
886     *  <li>{@code with}</li>
887     *  </ul>
888     *  All these are used in a {@code module-info.java} file.
889     *
890     *  @param  name   The String to check.
891     *  @return {@code true} if the given String is a valid name for the Java
892     *      language, {@code false} otherwise.
893     *
894     *  @see javax.lang.model.SourceVersion#isName(CharSequence, SourceVersion)
895     *  @see javax.lang.model.SourceVersion#isIdentifier(CharSequence)
896     *  @see javax.lang.model.SourceVersion#isKeyword(CharSequence, SourceVersion)
897     *  @see javax.lang.model.SourceVersion#latest()
898     */
899    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
900    public static final boolean isValidName( final CharSequence name )
901    {
902        final var retValue = SourceVersion.isName( requireNotEmptyArgument( name, "name" ) )
903            && !name.equals( "var" );
904
905        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
906        return retValue;
907    }   //  isValidName()
908
909    /**
910     *  Loads the class with the given name, using the instance of
911     *  {@link ClassLoader}
912     *  that loaded the caller's class, and returns that class. If no class
913     *  with that name could be found by that {@code ClassLoader}, no exception
914     *  will be thrown; instead this method will return an empty
915     *  {@link Optional}
916     *  instance.<br>
917     *  <br>If not loaded and initialised before, the loaded class is not yet
918     *  initialised. That means that {@code static} code blocks have not been
919     *  executed yet and class variables (static variables) are not
920     *  initialised.<br>
921     *  <br>Different from
922     *  {@link Class#forName(String, boolean, ClassLoader)},
923     *  this method is able to load the class objects for the primitive types,
924     *  too.
925     *
926     *  @param  classname   The name of the class to load; may <i>not</i> be
927     *      empty or {@code null}.
928     *  @return The class wrapped in an
929     *      {@link Optional}
930     *      instance.
931     *
932     *  @see Class#forName(String)
933     *  @see Class#forName(String, boolean, ClassLoader)
934     *  @see Optional#isPresent()
935     *  @see #getCallersClassLoader()
936     */
937    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
938    public static final Optional<Class<?>> loadClass( final String classname )
939    {
940        final var classLoader = getCallersClassLoader();
941        final var retValue = loadClass( classLoader, classname );
942
943        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
944        return retValue;
945    }   //  loadClass()
946
947    /**
948     *  Loads the class with the given name, using the given
949     *  {@link ClassLoader}
950     *  instance, and returns that class. If no class with that name could be
951     *  found by that {@code ClassLoader}, no exception will be thrown; instead
952     *  this method will return an empty
953     *  {@link Optional}
954     *  instance.<br>
955     *  <br>If not loaded and initialised before, the loaded class is not yet
956     *  initialised. That means that {@code static} code blocks have not been
957     *  executed yet and class variables (static variables) are not
958     *  initialised.<br>
959     *  <br>Different from
960     *  {@link Class#forName(String, boolean, ClassLoader)},
961     *  this method is able to load the class objects for the primitive types,
962     *  too.
963     *
964     *  @param  classLoader The class loader to use.
965     *  @param  classname   The name of the class to load; may <i>not</i> be
966     *      empty or {@code null}.
967     *  @return The class wrapped in an
968     *      {@link Optional}
969     *      instance.
970     *
971     *  @see Class#forName(String)
972     *  @see Class#forName(String, boolean, ClassLoader)
973     *  @see Optional#isPresent()
974     */
975    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
976    public static final Optional<Class<?>> loadClass( final ClassLoader classLoader, final String classname )
977    {
978        var resultClass = m_PrimitiveClasses.get( requireNotEmptyArgument( classname, "classname" ) );
979        if( isNull( resultClass ) )
980        {
981            try
982            {
983                resultClass = Class.forName( classname, false, requireNonNullArgument( classLoader, "classLoader" ) );
984            }
985            catch( @SuppressWarnings( "unused" ) final ClassNotFoundException e ) { /* Deliberately ignored */ }
986        }
987
988        //---* Create the return value *---------------------------------------
989        final Optional<Class<?>> retValue = Optional.ofNullable( resultClass );
990
991        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
992        return retValue;
993    }   //  loadClass()
994
995    /**
996     *  Loads the class with the given name, using the given
997     *  {@link ClassLoader}
998     *  instance, and returns that class, wrapped in an instance of
999     *  {@link Optional}.
1000     *  If no class with that name could be found by that instance of
1001     *  {@code ClassLoader}, or if it does not implement the given
1002     *  interface/extend the given class, no exception will be thrown; instead
1003     *  this method will return an empty
1004     *  {@link Optional}
1005     *  instance.<br>
1006     *  <br>If not loaded and initialised before, the loaded class is not yet
1007     *  initialised. That means that {@code static} code blocks have not been
1008     *  executed yet and class variables (static variables) are not
1009     *  initialised.
1010     *
1011     *  @param  <T> The type of the interface/class that the returned class
1012     *      will implement/extend.
1013     *  @param  classLoader The class loader to use.
1014     *  @param  classname   The name of the class to load; may <i>not</i> be
1015     *      empty or {@code null}.
1016     *  @param  implementing    The interface/class that the returned class
1017     *      has to implement/extend.
1018     *  @return The class wrapped in an
1019     *      {@link Optional}
1020     *      instance.
1021     *
1022     *  @see Class#forName(String)
1023     *  @see Class#forName(String, boolean, ClassLoader)
1024     *  @see Optional#isPresent()
1025     */
1026    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
1027    public static final <T> Optional<Class<? extends T>> loadClass( final ClassLoader classLoader, final String classname, final Class<? extends T> implementing )
1028    {
1029        Class<? extends T> resultClass = null;
1030        try
1031        {
1032            final var c = Class.forName( requireNotEmptyArgument( classname, "classname" ), false, requireNonNullArgument( classLoader, "classLoader" ) );
1033            if( requireNonNullArgument( implementing, "implementing" ).isAssignableFrom( c ) )
1034            {
1035                resultClass = c.asSubclass( implementing );
1036            }
1037        }
1038        catch( @SuppressWarnings( "unused" ) final ClassNotFoundException e ) { /* Deliberately ignored */ }
1039
1040        //---* Create the return value *---------------------------------------
1041        final Optional<Class<? extends T>> retValue = Optional.ofNullable( resultClass );
1042
1043        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
1044        return retValue;
1045    }   //  loadClass()
1046
1047    /**
1048     *  If no class with that name could be found by that instance of
1049     *  {@code ClassLoader}, or if it does not implement the given
1050     *  interface/extend the given class, no exception will be thrown; instead
1051     *  this method will return an empty
1052     *  {@link Optional}.<br>
1053     *  Loads the class with the given name, using the instance of
1054     *  {@link ClassLoader}
1055     *  that loaded the caller's class, and returns that class, wrapped in an
1056     *  instance of
1057     *  {@link Optional}.
1058     *  If no class with that name could be found by that instance of
1059     *  {@code ClassLoader}, or if it does not implement the given
1060     *  interface/extend the given class, no exception will be thrown; instead
1061     *  this method will return an empty
1062     *  {@link Optional}
1063     *  instance.<br>
1064     *  <br>If not loaded and initialised before, the loaded class is not yet
1065     *  initialised. That means that {@code static} code blocks have not been
1066     *  executed yet and class variables (static variables) are not
1067     *  initialised.
1068     *
1069     *  @param  <T> The type of the interface/class that the returned class
1070     *      will implement/extend.
1071     *  @param  classname   The name of the class to load; may <i>not</i> be
1072     *      empty or {@code null}.
1073     *  @param  implementing    The interface/class that the returned class
1074     *      has to implement/extend.
1075     *  @return The class wrapped in an
1076     *      {@link Optional}
1077     *      instance.
1078     *
1079     *  @see Class#forName(String)
1080     *  @see Class#forName(String, boolean, ClassLoader)
1081     *  @see Optional#isPresent()
1082     *  @see #getCallersClassLoader()
1083     */
1084    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
1085    public static final <T> Optional<Class<? extends T>> loadClass( final String classname, final Class<T> implementing )
1086    {
1087        final var classLoader = getCallersClassLoader();
1088        final var retValue = loadClass( classLoader, classname, implementing );
1089
1090        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
1091        return retValue;
1092    }   //  loadClass()
1093
1094    /**
1095     *  Retrieves the public getter for the property with the given name. If
1096     *  not {@code null}, the returned value will cause
1097     *  {@link #isGetter(Method)}
1098     *  to return {@code true}.
1099     *
1100     *  @param  beanClass   The class for the getter.
1101     *  @param  propertyName    The name of the property.
1102     *  @return An instance of
1103     *      {@link Optional}
1104     *      that holds the getter method; will be empty if there is no public
1105     *      getter for the given property on the provided class.
1106     *
1107     *  @see #isGetter(Method)
1108     *  @see #retrieveGetter(Class, String, boolean)
1109     */
1110    public static final Optional<Method> retrieveGetter( final Class<?> beanClass, final String propertyName )
1111    {
1112        final var retValue = retrieveGetter( beanClass, propertyName, true );
1113
1114        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
1115        return retValue;
1116    }   //  retrieveGetter()
1117
1118    /**
1119     *  Retrieves the getter for the property with the given name.<br>
1120     *  <br>Usually, a getter method has to be public, but for some purposes,
1121     *  it may be package local, protected or even private. A method returned
1122     *  by a call to this method will not cause
1123     *  {@link #isGetter(Method)}
1124     *  to return {@code true} in all cases.
1125     *
1126     *  @param  beanClass   The class for the getter.
1127     *  @param  propertyName    The name of the property.
1128     *  @param  isPublic    {@code true} if the getter is required to be
1129     *      public, {@code false} otherwise.
1130     *  @return An instance of
1131     *      {@link Optional}
1132     *      that holds the getter method; will be empty if there is no getter
1133     *      for the given property on the provided class.
1134     */
1135    @SuppressWarnings( "AssignmentToNull" )
1136    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
1137    public static final Optional<Method> retrieveGetter( final Class<?> beanClass, final String propertyName, final boolean isPublic )
1138    {
1139        requireNonNullArgument( beanClass, "beanClass" );
1140
1141        Method method = null;
1142
1143        if( !"class".equals( requireNotEmptyArgument( propertyName, "propertyName" ) ) )
1144        {
1145            var getterName = composeGetterName( propertyName );
1146
1147            //---* Retrieve a common getter *----------------------------------
1148            if( !isPublic )
1149            {
1150                try
1151                {
1152                    method = beanClass.getDeclaredMethod( getterName );
1153                }
1154                catch( @SuppressWarnings( "unused" ) final NoSuchMethodException e ) { /* Will be deliberately ignored */ }
1155            }
1156
1157            if( isNull( method ) )
1158            {
1159                try
1160                {
1161                    method = beanClass.getMethod( getterName );
1162                }
1163                catch( @SuppressWarnings( "unused" ) final NoSuchMethodException e ) { /* Will be deliberately ignored */ }
1164            }
1165
1166            if( isNull( method ) )
1167            {
1168                //---* Assume it is a boolean property ... *-------------------
1169                getterName = PREFIX_IS + capitalize( propertyName );
1170                if( !isPublic )
1171                {
1172                    try
1173                    {
1174                        method = beanClass.getDeclaredMethod( getterName );
1175                    }
1176                    catch( @SuppressWarnings( "unused" ) final NoSuchMethodException e ) { /* Will be deliberately ignored */ }
1177                }
1178
1179                if( isNull( method ) )
1180                {
1181                    try
1182                    {
1183                        method = beanClass.getMethod( getterName );
1184                    }
1185                    catch( @SuppressWarnings( "unused" ) final NoSuchMethodException e ) { /* Will be deliberately ignored */ }
1186                }
1187
1188                //---* Check the return type *---------------------------------
1189                if( nonNull( method ) )
1190                {
1191                    final var returnType = method.getReturnType();
1192                    if( !(returnType.equals( Boolean.class ) || returnType.equals( boolean.class )) )
1193                    {
1194                        method = null;
1195                    }
1196                }
1197            }
1198            else
1199            {
1200                //---* Check the return type *---------------------------------
1201                if( method.getReturnType().equals( void.class ) )
1202                {
1203                    method = null;
1204                }
1205            }
1206
1207            if( nonNull( method ) )
1208            {
1209                //---* Check if the method is public and not static *----------
1210                final var modifier = method.getModifiers();
1211                if( isStatic( modifier ) )
1212                {
1213                    method = null;
1214                }
1215                else if( !isPublic( modifier ) )
1216                {
1217                    if( isPublic )
1218                    {
1219                        method = null;
1220                    }
1221                    else
1222                    {
1223                        /*
1224                         * Ensure that the non-public method can be accessed.
1225                         */
1226                        method.setAccessible( true );
1227                    }
1228                }
1229            }
1230        }
1231
1232        //---* Compose the return value *--------------------------------------
1233        final var retValue = Optional.ofNullable( method );
1234
1235        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
1236        return retValue;
1237    }   //  retrieveGetter()
1238
1239    /**
1240     *  Returns all the getter methods from the given object.<br>
1241     *  <br><i>getter</i> methods ...
1242     *  <ul>
1243     *  <li>... are public</li>
1244     *  <li>... are <i>not</i> static</li>
1245     *  <li>... will return a value (are not {@code void}</li>
1246     *  <li>... do not take an argument</li>
1247     *  <li>... have a name that starts with &quot;{@code get}&quot;, followed
1248     *  by the name of the property that they return, with its first letter in
1249     *  uppercase (e.g. for the property &quot;{@code name}&quot;, get getter
1250     *  would be named &quot;{@code getName()}&quot;</li>
1251     *  <li>... may have a name that starts with &quot;{@code is}&quot; instead
1252     *  of &quot;{@code get}&quot; in case they return a {@code boolean}
1253     *  value.</li>
1254     *  </ul>
1255     *  <br>The method will ignore the method
1256     *  {@link Object#getClass()}
1257     *  that is present for each object instance.
1258     *
1259     *  @param  o   The object to inspect.
1260     *  @return The list of getters; it may be empty, but will never be
1261     *  {@code null}.
1262     *
1263     *  @see #isGetter(Method)
1264     */
1265    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
1266    public static final Method [] retrieveGetters( final Object o )
1267    {
1268        final var retValue =
1269            stream( requireNonNullArgument( o, "o" ).getClass().getMethods() )
1270                .filter( JavaUtils::isGetter )
1271                .toArray( Method []::new );
1272
1273        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
1274        return retValue;
1275    }   //  retrieveGetters()
1276
1277    /**
1278     *  <p>{@summary Retrieves the public method with the given signature from
1279     *  the given class.} The method will not throw an exception in case the
1280     *  method does not exist.
1281     *
1282     *  @param  sourceClass The class.
1283     *  @param  methodName  The name of the method.
1284     *  @param  args    The types of the method arguments.
1285     *  @return An instance of
1286     *      {@link Optional}
1287     *      that holds the found instance of
1288     *      {@link Method}.
1289     *
1290     *  @see Class#getMethod(String, Class[])
1291     *
1292     *  @since 0.1.0
1293     */
1294    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.1.0" )
1295    public static final Optional<Method> retrieveMethod( final Class<?> sourceClass, final String methodName, final Class<?>... args )
1296    {
1297        Optional<Method> retValue = Optional.empty();
1298        try
1299        {
1300            final var method = sourceClass.getMethod( methodName, args );
1301            retValue = Optional.of( method );
1302        }
1303        catch( final NoSuchMethodException e ) { /* Deliberately ignored */ }
1304
1305        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
1306        return retValue;
1307    }   //  retrieveMethod()
1308
1309    /**
1310     *  Retrieves the name of the property from the name of the given
1311     *  executable element for a method that is either a
1312     *  {@linkplain #isGetter(Element) getter},
1313     *  a
1314     *  {@linkplain #isSetter(Element) setter},
1315     *  or an
1316     *  {@linkplain #isAddMethod(Element) 'add'}
1317     *  method. Alternatively the method has an annotation that provides the
1318     *  name of the property.
1319     *
1320     *  @param  method  The method.
1321     *  @return The name of the property.
1322     */
1323    public static final String retrievePropertyName( final ExecutableElement method )
1324    {
1325        final String retValue;
1326        final var propertyNameAnnotation = requireNonNullArgument( method, "method" ).getAnnotation( PropertyName.class );
1327        if( nonNull( propertyNameAnnotation ) )
1328        {
1329            retValue = propertyNameAnnotation.value();
1330        }
1331        else
1332        {
1333            final var methodName = requireValidArgument( method, "method", v -> isGetter( v ) || isSetter( v ) || isAddMethod( v ), $ -> format( "'%s()' is not a valid type of method", method.getSimpleName() ) ).getSimpleName().toString();
1334
1335            /*
1336             * We know that the method is either a getter, a setter or an 'add'
1337             * method. Therefore, we know also that the name starts either with
1338             * "get", "set", "add" or "is".
1339             */
1340            final var pos = methodName.startsWith( PREFIX_IS ) ? PREFIX_IS.length() : PREFIX_GET.length();
1341            retValue = decapitalize( methodName.substring( pos ) );
1342        }
1343
1344        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
1345        return retValue;
1346    }   //  retrievePropertyName()
1347
1348    /**
1349     *  Retrieves the public setter for the property with the given name. If
1350     *  not {@code null}, the returned value will cause
1351     *  {@link #isSetter(Method)}
1352     *  to return {@code true}.
1353     *
1354     *  @param  beanClass   The class for the getter.
1355     *  @param  propertyName    The name of the property.
1356     *  @param  propertyType    The type of the property.
1357     *  @return An instance of
1358     *      {@link Optional}
1359     *      that holds the setter method; will be empty if there is no public
1360     *      setter for the given property on the provided class.
1361     *
1362     *  @see #retrieveSetter(Class,String,Class,boolean)
1363     */
1364    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
1365    public static final Optional<Method> retrieveSetter( final Class<?> beanClass, final String propertyName, final Class<?> propertyType )
1366    {
1367        final var retValue = retrieveSetter( beanClass, propertyName, propertyType, true );
1368
1369        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
1370        return retValue;
1371    }   //  retrieveSetter()
1372
1373    /**
1374     *  Retrieves the setter for the property with the given name.<br>
1375     *  <br>For some purposes, non-public setters are quite useful; when
1376     *  {@code isPublic} is provided as {@code false}, this method will also
1377     *  return those setters.
1378     *
1379     *  @param  beanClass   The class for the getter.
1380     *  @param  propertyName    The name of the property.
1381     *  @param  propertyType    The type of the property.
1382     *  @param  isPublic    {@code true} if the setter is required to be
1383     *      public, {@code false} otherwise.
1384     *  @return An instance of
1385     *      {@link Optional}
1386     *      that holds the setter method; will be empty if there is no setter
1387     *      for the given property on the provided class.
1388     *
1389     *  @see #isSetter(Method)
1390     */
1391    @SuppressWarnings( "AssignmentToNull" )
1392    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
1393    public static final Optional<Method> retrieveSetter( final Class<?> beanClass, final String propertyName, final Class<?> propertyType, final boolean isPublic )
1394    {
1395        requireNonNullArgument( beanClass, "beanClass" );
1396        requireNonNullArgument( propertyType, "propertyType" );
1397
1398        //---* Retrieve a common setter *--------------------------------------
1399        Method method = null;
1400        if( !isPublic )
1401        {
1402            try
1403            {
1404                /*
1405                 *  Class.getDeclaredMethod() will return any method with the
1406                 *  given name that is declared on the given class, no matter
1407                 *  whether it is public or private.
1408                 */
1409                method = beanClass.getDeclaredMethod( composeSetterName( propertyName ), propertyType );
1410            }
1411            catch( @SuppressWarnings( "unused" ) final NoSuchMethodException e ) { /* Will be deliberately ignored */ }
1412        }
1413
1414        /*
1415         * method is null here, either because isPublic() is true, or the
1416         * public (or protected) method was not declared on the given class,
1417         * but inherited from the parent class (or it does not exist at all
1418         * ...)
1419         */
1420        if( isNull( method ) )
1421        {
1422            try
1423            {
1424                method = beanClass.getMethod( composeSetterName( propertyName ), propertyType );
1425            }
1426            catch( @SuppressWarnings( "unused" ) final NoSuchMethodException e ) { /* Will be deliberately ignored */ }
1427        }
1428
1429        /*
1430         * We found a method with the right name, now have to perform some
1431         * checks on it.
1432         */
1433        if( nonNull( method ) )
1434        {
1435            //---* Check the return value *------------------------------------
1436            if( !method.getReturnType().equals( void.class ) )
1437            {
1438                method = null; // Wrong return type ...
1439            }
1440            else
1441            {
1442                //---* Check if the method is public and not static *----------
1443                final var modifier = method.getModifiers();
1444                if( isStatic( modifier ) )
1445                {
1446                    method = null; // Setters are never static
1447                }
1448                else if( !isPublic( modifier ) )
1449                {
1450                    if( isPublic )
1451                    {
1452                        method = null; // It has to be public, but it isn't
1453                    }
1454                    else
1455                    {
1456                        /*
1457                         * Ensure that the non-public method can be accessed.
1458                         */
1459                        method.setAccessible( true );
1460                    }
1461                }
1462            }
1463        }
1464
1465        //---* Compose the return value *--------------------------------------
1466        final var retValue = Optional.ofNullable( method );
1467
1468        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
1469        return retValue;
1470    }   //  retrieveSetter()
1471
1472    /**
1473     *  Searches the given stack trace for references to the method with the
1474     *  given name and returns the name for the respective class.<br>
1475     *  <br>This is a helper method for
1476     *  {@link #findMainClass()}.
1477     *
1478     *  @param  stackTrace  The stack trace.
1479     *  @param  methodName  The name of the method to look for.
1480     *  @return The class name, or {@code null} if there is no reference to
1481     *      the given method in the stack trace.
1482     */
1483    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
1484    private static final String searchStackTrace( final StackTraceElement [] stackTrace, final String methodName )
1485    {
1486        assert nonNull( stackTrace ) : "stackTrace is null";
1487        assert isNotEmpty( methodName ) : "methodName is empty or null";
1488
1489        String retValue = null;
1490        String foundMethodName;
1491        for( var i = stackTrace.length; (i > 0) && isNull( retValue ); --i )
1492        {
1493            foundMethodName = stackTrace [i-1].getMethodName();
1494            if( foundMethodName.equals( methodName ) )
1495            {
1496                retValue = stackTrace [i-1].getClassName();
1497            }
1498        }
1499
1500        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
1501        return retValue;
1502    }   //  searchStackTrace()
1503
1504    /**
1505     *  <p>{@summary Translates the integer value for the modifiers for a
1506     *  class, method or field as it is used by reflection to the {@code enum}
1507     *  values from
1508     *  {@link Modifier}.}</p>
1509     *  <p>The modifier
1510     *  {@link javax.lang.model.element.Modifier#DEFAULT}
1511     *  will not be in the return set as this cannot be retrieved at runtime,
1512     *  and the value
1513     *  {@link java.lang.reflect.Modifier#INTERFACE}
1514     *  does not exist as an {@code enum} value in
1515     *  {@link javax.lang.model.element.Modifier}.</p>
1516     *  <p>The modifiers {@code sealed} and {@code non-sealed}, belonging to
1517     *  the preview feature 'Sealed Classes' are defined in
1518     *  {@code javax.lang.model.element.Modifier}, but
1519     *  {@link Class#getModifiers()}
1520     *  will not return them, and they are not (yet) defined in
1521     *  {@link java.lang.reflect.Modifier}. Therefore they will not appear in
1522     *  the return set, too.</p>
1523     *
1524     *  @param  modifiers   The integer value for the modifiers.
1525     *  @return The modifier values.
1526     *
1527     *  @see javax.lang.model.element.Modifier#NON_SEALED
1528     *  @see javax.lang.model.element.Modifier#SEALED
1529     */
1530    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
1531    public static final Set<Modifier> translateModifiers( final int modifiers )
1532    {
1533        final Set<Modifier> retValue = EnumSet.noneOf( Modifier.class );
1534        if( isAbstract( modifiers ) ) retValue.add( ABSTRACT );
1535        if( isFinal( modifiers ) ) retValue.add( FINAL );
1536        if( isNative( modifiers ) ) retValue.add( NATIVE );
1537        if( isPrivate( modifiers ) ) retValue.add( PRIVATE );
1538        if( isProtected( modifiers ) ) retValue.add( PROTECTED );
1539        if( isPublic( modifiers ) ) retValue.add( PUBLIC );
1540        if( isStatic( modifiers ) ) retValue.add( STATIC );
1541        if( isStrict( modifiers ) ) retValue.add( STRICTFP );
1542        if( isSynchronized( modifiers ) ) retValue.add( SYNCHRONIZED );
1543        if( isTransient( modifiers ) ) retValue.add( TRANSIENT );
1544        if( isVolatile( modifiers ) ) retValue.add( VOLATILE );
1545
1546        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
1547        return retValue;
1548    }   //  translateModifiers()
1549}
1550//  class JavaUtils
1551
1552/*
1553 *  End of File
1554 */
